intro: Gomidesia riedeliana, commonly known as the Riedel's gomidesia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of southern Brazil. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup, typical of many bromeliads. The plant produces small, white flowers that emerge from the center of the rosette, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
